intro: Ceratostema hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy ceratostema, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and covered with fine, hairy texture, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
